C.Repair

C.修复

(1) Repair of ATA 34-50: ATC-DME antennas leading edge erosion from CHELTON (F6175) former RAYAN (F6987) - DORNE&MARGOLIN (85226).
(1)修复 ATA 34-50: ATC-DME 天线从切尔顿(F6175)前 RAYAN (F6987)-DORNE & MARGOLIN (85226)引起的边缘侵蚀。

CHELTON (F6175) former RAYAN (F6987) - DORNE&MARGOLIN (85226).Blade shaped antennas are, by design, subject to erosion of their leading edge, and may require subsequent paint rework. In case of paint erosion, the antennas may be repainted on their leading edges. For this purpose, the antenna area where paint application is possible is given in Figure 012 and Figure 013.

切尔顿(F6175)前瑞安(F6987)-多恩 & 马戈林(85226)。叶片形状的天线，按照设计，容易受到侵蚀的前缘，并可能需要随后的油漆返工。在油漆侵蚀的情况下，天线的前缘可以重新油漆。为此，图012和图013给出了可以喷漆的天线区域。

(a) Use abrasive cloth/paper 240 grade or finer to prepare the surface and chamfer the edges of the abraded paint to give a smooth finish.
(a)使用240级或较细的砂布/纸张预备表面，并将磨损的油漆边缘倒角，使表面光滑。

NOTE: It is necessary to remove the paint down to the metal surface to ensure a good adhesion of the paint coat.

提示: 为了确保涂层具有良好的附着力，有必要将涂层移至金属表面。

(b) Clean the repair area with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BAA9).

(b)用清洁剂(物料编号08BAA9)清洁维修范围。

(c) Apply structure paint (Material No. 04JAA3 or (Material No. 04JBA3).
(c)应用结构漆(材料编号04JAA3或(材料编号04JBA3)。

The thickness of the applied paint layer must not exceed 350 microns (13780 microinches). It has also be of the same color as the original. Fot the color, refer to the standards given in the CMM for each Antenna Part Number.
涂层厚度不得超过350微米(13780微英寸)。它的颜色也和原来的一样。关于颜色，请参考 CMM 中给出的每个天线部件号的标准。

NOTE: However, if the operator elects to paint in-house their antennas, the limitations of the CMM with regard to the physical condition of antenna, apply. In particular, any antenna showing paint cracks or any other physical damage must be removed and shall not be repainted.
提示: 然而，如果操作员选择在内部喷漆他们的天线，三坐标测量机有关天线的物理条件的局限性，适用。特别是，任何显示油漆裂缝或任何其他物理损坏的天线必须拆除，不得重新油漆。

NOTE: In addition, in order to prevent erosion, a possible solution is given in paragraph 12..
提示:另外，为了防止侵蚀，第12段给出了一个可能的解决方案。

(2)Repair of communication antennas ATA 23-11: HF Antennas.

(2)修理通信天线 ATA 23-11: HF 天线。

(a) If slight corrosion marks are reported on the HF antennas, a corrosion treatment can be applied only on the contaminated surface.

(a)如报告高频天线有轻微的腐蚀痕迹，则只可在受污染的表面进行腐蚀处理。

1 Remove the corrosion by abrading. Use abrasive cloth/paper 100 grade and finish with 240 grade.

1通过研磨来消除腐蚀。使用100级的砂布/纸，并用240级的砂布完成。

2 Chamfer the edges of the abraded paint to give a smooth finish.

2将磨损的油漆边缘倒角，使其表面光滑。

3 Clean the abraded and surrounding area with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BAA9).

3用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BAA9)清洁磨损及周围区域。

4 Mask of the area that is to be repainted.

4需要重新粉刷区域的遮盖。

5 Apply primer (Material No. 16-006B).

5 .涂底漆(材料号16-006B)。

6 Apply top coat CA 8000 with BAC 7067 (Material No. 16-018E).

6 涂料面漆 CA8000 with7067（材料编号16-018E）

7 Remove the masking tape.
7取下遮蔽胶带。

NOTE: If heavy corrosion of the HF antennas is reported (resulting in noticeable HF range reduction), the replacement of the antenna is necessary.

提示: 如果报告的高频天线严重腐蚀(导致明显的高频范围缩小) ，更换天线是必要的。

(3) Repair of ATA 23-12: VHF Antennas.

(3)修理 ATA 23-12: 高频天线。

(a) CHELTON (F6175) former RAYAN (F6987) - DORNE&MARGOLIN (85226)
(a)谢尔顿(F6175)前瑞安(F6987)-多恩及马戈林(85226)

Blade shaped antennas are, by design, subject to erosion of the leading edge, and may require subsequent paint rework, in case of paint erosion, the antennas may be repainted on their leading edges. For this purpose, the antenna area where paint application is possible is given in Figure Figure 014 and Figure 015.

根据设计，叶片形天线的前缘容易受到侵蚀，并且可能需要随后的油漆返工，在油漆侵蚀的情况下，天线的前缘可能会被重新油漆。为此，图014和图015给出了可以喷漆的天线区域。

(b) Use abrasive cloth/paper 240 grade o0r finer to prepare the surface and chamfer the edges of the abraded paint to give a smooth finish.
(b)使用240级或较细的砂布/纸张预备表面，并将磨损的油漆边缘倒角，使表面光滑。

(c) Clean the abraded and surrounding area with cleaning agent (Material No. 16-026). Apply top coat (Material No. 08AEB1 or 04JBA3). The thickness of the applied paint layer must not exceed 350 microns (13780 microinches). It has also to be of the same color as the original. For the color refer to the standards given in the CMM for each antenna part number.
(c)用清洁剂(物料编号16-026)清洁磨损的地方及周围地方。应用面漆(材料编号08AEB1或04JBA3)。涂层厚度不得超过350微米(13780微英寸)。它也必须是原来的一样的颜色。对于颜色，请参考 CMM 中给出的每个天线零件编号的标准。

NOTE: However, if the operator selects to paint in-house their antennas, the limitation of the CMM with regards to the physical condition of the antenna, apply. In particular, any antenna showing paint cracks or any other physical damage must be removed and shall not be re-painted.

提示: 然而，如果操作员选择在内部喷漆他们的天线，三坐标测量机在天线的物理条件方面的限制适用。特别是，任何显示油漆裂缝或任何其他物理损坏的天线必须拆除，不得重新油漆。

(4) Application of Fluorescent Paint on ATC-DME-VHF antennas.
(4)荧光涂料在ATC-DME-VHF天线上的应用。

Antennas protruding fro the lower fuselage ATC-DME-VHF systems) can be damaged by movement of ground personnel therefore fluorescent paint can be applied on specific areas of those antennas fins.

从下机身伸出的天线(ATC-DME-VHF系统)可能被地面人员的移动损坏，因此可以在这些天线鳍的特定区域涂上荧光漆。

(a) Lightly abrade the areas to be painted with SCOTCH-BRITE pads, refer to Figure 012, Figure 013, Figure 014 and Figure 015.

(a)用百洁布衬垫轻轻打磨待涂区域，参见图012、图013、图014和图015。

(b) Clean the abraded and surrounding area with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BAA9).

(b)用清洗剂(物料号08BBF1或08BAA9)清洗磨损及周围区域。

(c) Apply fluorescent paint in 2 layers: CA8000 white M8001 100 microns (3937 microinches (Material No. 04JBA3)) then CA8000E03613 yellow fluor 60 microns (2362 microinches (Material No. 04JBA3)).
(c)分两层涂荧光漆:CA8000 white M8001 100微米(3937微英寸(材料号04JBA3))和 CA8000 E03613 黄色荧光 60微米(2362微英寸(材料号04JBA3))

NOTE: The fluorescent paint to be used must be no-conductive and applied with a maximum layer thickness of 350 microns (13780 microinches).
提示:要使用的荧光漆必须是不导电的，并且应用的最大层厚度为350微米(13780微英寸)。

12. Application of ANTI-EROSION Tape on VHF, ATC/DME Antennas.

12.抗腐蚀胶带在VHF、ATC/DME天线上的应用。

A.General

(1) The concerned antennas are the VHF, and ATC/DME antennas. The application of polyurethane adhesive tape on these blade type antennas is authorized if the antenna area where the radiating element is located, is not covered. Refer to Figure 012, Figure 013, Figure 014 and Figure 015.
(1)有关的天线为甚高频天线和 ATC/DME 天线。如果辐射元件所在的天线区域没有被覆盖，授权在这些刀片型天线上使用聚氨酯胶带。请参阅图012、图013、图014和图015。

CAUTION: IN CASE OF APPLICATION OF SUCH A TAPE ON THE LEADING EDGE OF THESE ANTENNAS, PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT THIS COULD BE THE ORIGIN OF MICRO ELECTRO-STATIC DISCHARGES OF THE ANTENNAS. IN SUCH A CASE, THE ELECTRO-STATIC DISCHARGES COULD RESULT IN NOISE. THEREFORE, IF THE FLIGHT CREW REPORTS STATIC NOISE ON THE VHF AFTER APPLICATION OF THE ADHESIVE TAPE, WE RECOMMEND THE OPERATOR TO REMOVE THIS TAPE.

注意:如果在这些天线的前缘应用这种胶带，请注意这可能是天线微静电放电的来源。在这种情况下，静电放电会产生噪音。因此，如果机组人员在使用胶带后报告VHF上有静电噪音，我们建议操作员拆除该胶带。

(2) This procedure is not recommended for all other type of antennas (Radio Altimeter, TCAS, GPS, SATCOM, ADF for example).

(2)此程序不推荐用于所有其他类型的天线(例如无线电高度表、 TCAS、 GPS、 SATCOM、 ADF)。

C. Procedure

C.程序

(1) Remove the AOA plate, refer to AMM Chapter 34-11-19-000-001-A (only paint the AOA plate).

(1)拆卸 AOA 牌照，请参阅 AMM 章34-11-19-000-001-A (只涂 AOA 牌照)。

(2) Mask off holes and markings with self adhesive aluminium tape (Material No. 05RAB9).

(2)用铝胶带遮盖洞口及标记(物料编号05RAB9)。

(3)Remove the paint, refer to Chapter 51-75-11.

(3)去掉油漆，参照第51-75-11章。

(4)Remove the self adhesive aluminium tape.

(4)拆铝胶带。

(5)Clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or Material No. 08BAA9 or Material No. 08BBD1).
(5)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或物料编号08BAA9或物料编号08BBD1)清洁及除去表面的油脂。

NOTE: Alternative solvent can be used, refer to AIMS 09-00-002.

提示: 可使用替代溶剂，请参阅 AIMS 09-00-002。

(6) Mask off areas which will not be repainted (holes and markings) with masking tape/paper.

(6)用胶带或纸张遮盖不会重新油漆的地方(洞及标记)。

(7)Apply the appropriate primer as follows:
(7)按下列方法涂上适当的底漆:

-Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) on top of wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2).
- 聚氨酯底漆(物料编号04EAC2)在清洗底漆(物料编号04CMA2)之上。

NOTE: No wash primer required if no bare metal exposed.
提示: 如果没有裸露的金属，则不需要清洗底漆。

- Polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) or epoxy primer (Material No. 04DAB2) or low VOC primer (Material No. 04DBA3) on top of chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1).
- 聚氨酯底漆(物料编号04EAC2)或环氧底漆(物料编号04DAB2)或低挥发性有机化合物底漆(物料编号04DABA3)加在化学转化涂层(物料编号10ABC1)上。

(8)Apply polyurethane top coat grey BAC 707 (Material No. 04JAA3 or Material No. 04JBA3) for post modification 153214 and modification 153213 conical plates or post modification 154862 new flat plates removed from the aircraft. And Material No. 04JAA3with livery color for old plate old flat blanking plates (P/N D3411007620000 or D3411013520000).

(8)在后改装153214及后改装153213块锥形板或后改装154862块新平板时，采用聚氨酯面层灰色的 BAC707(材料编号04JAA3或材料编号04JBA3)。材料编号04JAA3，涂装颜色，适用于老板旧平板下料(P/N D3411007620000或 D3411013520000)。

(9)Remove the masking tape/paper.

(9)除去遮蔽胶带/纸张。

(10)Make sure that one hole for electrical bonding is free from paint.

(10)确保一个电子连接孔没有油漆。

(11) Install the AOA sensor, refer to AMM Chapter 34-11-19-400-001-A.

(11)安装 AOA 传感器，请参阅 AMM 第34-11-19-400-001-A 章。

(12)Paint fasteners according to 7 . technique (Repair of peeled-off paint coatings on fastener heads).
(12)按 7 .涂装紧固件。技术(紧固件头油漆涂层剥落修复)。

NOTE: If marks of paint are noticed on the AOA vane, clear them off very carefully using Material No. 09EBA1 or 09EBB1 or 09BBB1 (Strippers) and a Material No. 14SBA1 (Lint-free cotton cloth). Do not use metallic tools or abrasive paper.
提示: 如果注意到 AOA 叶片上的油漆痕迹，使用材料号09EBA1或09EBB1或09BBB1(剥离器)和材料号14SBA1(无绒棉布)非常小心地清除它们。不要使用金属工具或研磨纸。

C.Repair

C.修复

(1)Remove completely the airline finish with abrasive paper grade 240 or finer and chamfer the edges of the remaining paint around the damaged area, if required.

15.Renewal of external Paint Build-up on Fuselage with intermediate Coat Paint Scheme.

15.用中间涂层方案更新机身外部油漆

CAUTION: THIS PROCEDURE IS NOT APPLICABLE TO THE RADOME AND TO ANTENNAS.

注意: 本程序不适用于天线罩和天线。

A.General

NOTE: Do not renew with intermediate coat for the following parts:
提示: 以下部分不要用中间涂层更换:

-Radome
-雷达天线罩

-Antennas
-天线

-Wing, HTP
-小翼, HTP

-Leading edge of vertical stabilizer
- 垂直尾翼前缘

NOTE: The maximum recommended paint thickness is 350 microns (13780 microinches) and 400 microns (15748 microinches) on the nacelles.
注意:机舱的最大推荐油漆厚度为350微米(13780微英寸)和400微米(15748微英寸)。

Around static ports and pitot probes (RVSM), the step between unpainted and painted areas must not exceed 400 microns (15748 microinches).
在静态端口（静压孔）和皮托管探头(RVSM)周围，未涂漆区域和涂漆区域之间的步长不得超过400微米(15748微英寸)。

If the recommended paint thickness is exceeded it can cause electrical discharge, which can interfere with communication and navigation systems.

如果超过建议的涂料厚度，就会导致放电，从而干扰通信和导航系统。

(1) This procedure is applicable after complete paint stripping, refer to Chapter 51-57-11.

(2)该工作包括应用含有中间涂层的外部涂料方案。

(3) Before you start with the procedure refer to Chapter 51-23-11 and determine the required paint build-up.

(3)在开始操作程序之前，请参考第51-23-11章，并确定所需的油漆积聚量。

C. Repair

C.修复

(1) Perform a visual inspection of the fuselage external surface after stripping.

(1)脱漆后，对机身外表面进行目视检查。

(2) If the fuselage was painted with intermediate coat, ensure that the previous intermediate coat layer was completely removed and the primer was lightly abraded and cleaned with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBD1), refer to Chapter 51-75-11.

For the other cases, lightly abrade with SCOTCH-BRITE or abrasive paper, grade 240 or finer and clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BBD1 or 08BAA9).
(2)如果机身涂有中间涂层，应确保先前的中间涂层被完全去除，底漆被轻微擦伤，并用清洁剂(材料编号08BBD1)清洗，请参阅第51-75-11章。

(3) Mask off areas which will not be repainted, refer to Paragraph 4..
（3)屏蔽不需要重新粉刷的区域，参见第4段。

(4)If bare metal is exposed or basic primer is too thin (less than 20 microns (787 microinches)) protect the exposed bare metal as follows:

(4)裸露金属或基本底漆太薄(小于20微米(787微英寸))时，保护裸露金属如下:

-with chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1) and primer (Material No. 04EAC2 or 04DAB2), refer to Chapter 51-21-11, Paragraph 2.B or
- 使用化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1)和底漆(材料编号04EAC2或04DAB2) ，请参阅第51-21-11章第2段。B 或

-with wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2) and primer (Material No. 04EAC2).
- 使用清洗底漆(物料编号04CMA2)及底漆(物料编号04EAC2)。

NOTE: On titanium parts follow the same instructions but without the chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1), apply primer or wash primer within 4 hours after abrasion and cleaning.

注意: 对于钛合金零件，按照同样的说明，但不使用化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1) ，在磨损和清洗后4小时内涂上底漆或清洗底漆。

(5) Let the primer dry for 4 hours minimum at room temperature or up to the dry to sand time (refer to the material technical data sheet). If required feather the edge with fine abrasive paper or SCOTCH-BRITE, remove sanding residues and clean with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBD1 or 08BAA9).

(5)让底漆在室温下至少干燥4小时或干燥至出砂时间(请参阅材料技术资料表)。如果需要用细磨料纸或 SCOTCH-BRITE 羽毛边缘，去除砂光残留物，并用清洁剂(材料号08BBD1或08BAA9)清洁。

(6)On composite parts requiring anti-static coating, renew the damaged anti-static coating in accordance with paragraph 5.

or paragraph 6..

(6)对需要防静电涂层的复合材料零件，按照第5款的规定更换损坏的防静电涂层。或者第6段……

(7)Apply primer (Material No. 04DCA3) to all surfaces (except the radome).
(7)在所有表面(雷达天线罩除外)涂上底漆(材料编号04DCA3)。

NOTE: Primer is not necessary on radome, go on with step 15..C..(8)
提示: 雷达罩上不需要底漆，请继续步骤15..C..(8)

NOTE: For local repair in step 15..C..(4) or the reactivation step 15..C..(7), you can also use Material No. 16-006B instead of Material No. 04DCA3, but only in combination with Material No. 04GDA3from PPG and top coat Material No. 04JBA3 .

提示:对于步骤15..C..(4)的局部修复或步骤15..C..(7)的再激活，也可以使用材料16-006B代替材料04DCA3，但只能与PPG材料04gda3和面漆材料04JBA3结合使用

(8)Apply intermediate coat on fuselage external surface zone D1, refer to Chapter 51-23-11, Figure 1, sheet 1, VTP except leading edge, nacelle.
(8)在机身外表面 D1区涂覆中间涂层，请参阅第51-23-11章，图1，第1页，VTP，前缘，驾驶舱除外。

NOTE: Follow the manufacturer’s data sheet for over coating time, thickness and masking procedure.

提示: 根据制造商的数据表，超涂时间，厚度和遮蔽程序。

(9) Apply top coat (Material No. 04JBA3), or base coat (Material No. 04LDA3) with clear coat (Material No. 04MDA3).

(9)涂覆面层(材料编号04JBA3)或底层(材料编号04LDA3) ，涂覆透明涂层(材料编号04MDA3)。

(10) Remove the masking tape/masking paper.

(10)拆下遮蔽胶带/遮蔽纸。

(11) If required, renew the external marking in accordance with AMM Chapter 11-20-00.

(11)如有需要，按照 AMM 第11-20-00章的规定更换外部标记。

Around static ports and pitot probes (RVSM), the step between unpainted and painted areas must not exceed 400 microns (15748 microinches).
在静态端口和皮托管探头(RVSM)周围，未涂漆区域和涂漆区域之间的步长不得超过400微米(15748微英寸)。

If the recommended paint thickness is exceeded, it can cause electrical discharge, which can interfere with communication and navigation systems.

如果超过建议的涂料厚度，就会导致放电，从而干扰通信和导航系统。

C.Repair

C.修复

(1)Perform a visual inspection of the fuselage external surface after stripping.

(1)剥离后，对机身外表面进行目视检查。

(2)Lightly abrade with SCOTCH-BRITE or abrasive paper grade 240 or finer.

(2)用 SCOTCH-BRITE 或砂纸等级240或以上轻微研磨。

(3)Clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BBD1 or 08BAA9).
(3)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BBD1或08BAA9)清洁及除去表面的油脂。

NOTE: On anti-erosion coating (Material No. 04PAH3) use cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBD1) only.
提示: 在防腐蚀涂层(材料号04PAH3)上仅使用清洗剂(材料号08BBD1)。

NOTE: Alternative solvent can be used, refer to AIMS 09-00-002.

提示: 可使用替代溶剂，请参阅 AIMS 09-00-002。

(4)Remove dirt on the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BBD1 or 08BAA9).

(4)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BBD1或08BAA9)清除表面污垢。
NOTE: Alternative solvent can be used, refer to AIMS 09-00-002.

提示：可以使用替代溶剂，请参阅 AIMS 09-00-002。

(5)Mask off areas which will not be repainted, refer to paragraph 4..

(5)将不会重新油漆的地方遮盖起来，请参阅第4段。

(6)If bare material is exposed or the basic primer is too thin (below 20 microns (787 microinches), refer to NTM Chapter 51-10-00 for coating thickness measurement), protect the exposed bare metal as follows:
(6)如裸露物料外露或基本底漆太薄(20微米以下(787微寸) ，有关测量涂层厚度的资料，请参阅 NTM 第51-10-00章) ，须按以下方法保护裸露的裸露金属:

-with chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1) and primer (Material No. 04EAC2 or 04DAB2), refer to Chapter 51-21-11, Paragraph 2.B or
- 使用化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1)和底漆(材料编号04EAC2或04DAB2) ，请参阅第51-21-11章第2段。B 或

-with wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2) and primer (Material No. 04EAC2).
- 使用清洗底漆(物料编号04CMA2)及底漆(物料编号04EAC2)。

NOTE: On titanium parts follow the same instructions but without the chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1), apply primer or wash primer within 4 hours after abrasion and cleaning.
提示: 对于钛合金零件，按照同样的说明，但不使用化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1) ，在磨损和清洗后4小时内涂上底漆或清洗底漆。

NOTE: If you use:
提示: 如果使用:

Wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2) + polyurethane primer (Material No. 04EAC2) + base coat (Material No. 04LDA3) + clear coat (Material No. 04MDA3) from the same paint manufacturer).
清洗底漆(材料编号04CMA2) + 聚氨酯底漆(材料编号04EAC2) + 底漆(材料编号04LDA3) + 透明漆(材料编号04MDA3)。

Chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1) + structure paint (Material No. 16-060A (37098)) + structure paint (Material No. 16-064A) + base coat (Material No. 04LDA3) + clear coat (Material No. 04MDA3),
化学转化涂料(材料编号10ABC1) + 结构涂料(材料编号16-060A (37098)) + 结构涂料(材料编号16-064A) + 基材涂料(材料编号04LDA3) + 透明涂料(材料编号04MDA3) ,

you can omit the application of primer (Material No. 04DCA3).

你可以省略底漆的应用(材料编号04DCA3)。

(7) Let the primer dry for 4 hours minimum at room temperature or up to the dry to sand time (refer to the material technical data sheet). If required feather the edge with fine abrasive paper or SCOTCH-BRITE, remove sanding residues and clean with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBD1 or 08BAA9).

(7)让底漆在室温下至少干燥4小时，或直至干燥至出砂时间(参阅材料技术资料表)。如果需要用细磨料纸或 SCOTCH-BRITE 羽毛边缘，去除砂光残留物，并用清洁剂(材料号08BBD1或08BAA9)清洁。

(8)On composite parts requiring anti-static coating, renew the damaged anti-static coating in accordance with paragraph

5.or paragraph 6..

（8）对于需要涂防静电涂料的复合部件，应按款规定更换损坏的防静电涂料
第5.或者第6段……

(9)Apply primer (Material No. 04DCA3) to all surfaces (except the radome or anti-erosion coating (Material No. 04PAH3)).
(9)在所有表面涂上底漆(物料编号04DCA3)(天线罩或防腐蚀涂层(物料编号04PAH3)除外)。

NOTE: On radome or areas with anti-erosion coating (Material No. 04PAH3) apply only the finish, go on with step 16..C..(10).
提示:在天线罩或有抗侵蚀涂层(材料号04PAH3)的区域，只进行表面处理，继续步骤16..C..(10)。

NOTE: Mix Material No. 04DCA3 for 3 minutes at minimum.
提示:将04DCA3号物料混合至少3分钟。

NOTE: The fuselage skin and the ambient shop temperature must be above 20 °C (68.0 °F) during application and drying.

提示:在应用和干燥过程中，机身外壳和环境温度必须高于20°C(68.0°F)。

(10)Apply base coat (Material No. 04LDA3) + clear coat (Material No. 04MDA3).

(10)涂敷底漆(材料号04LDA3) + 清漆(材料号04MDA3)。

(11)Remove the masking tape/masking paper.

(11)拆下遮蔽胶带/遮蔽纸。

(12)If required, renew the external marking in accordance with AMM Chapter 11-20-00.
(12)如有需要，按照 AMM 第11-20-00章的规定更换外部标记。

NOTE: Technical marking made from Material No. 05VGM3can be installed between base coat (after a minimum cure time of 6h) and the clear coat.

提示: 由05VGM3材料制成的技术标记可安装在底漆(最短固化时间6小时后)和透明涂层之间。

17.Renewal of external Paint Build-up with Chromate free Paint Scheme.

17.使用无铬酸盐涂料方案更新外部油漆。

A.General

NOTE: The maximum recommended paint thickness is 350 microns (13780 microinches) and 400 microns (15748 microinches) on nacelles.
提示: 最大推荐涂料厚度为350微米(13780微英寸)和400微米(15748微英寸)的机舱。

Around static ports and pitot probes (RVSM), the step between unpainted and painted areas must not exceed 400 microns (15748 microinches).
在静态端口和皮托管探头(RVSM)周围，未涂漆区域和涂漆区域之间的步长不得超过400微米(15748微英寸)。

If the recommended paint thickness is exceeded, it can cause electrical discharge, which can interfere with communication and navigation systems.

如果超过建议的涂料厚度，就会导致放电，从而干扰通信和导航系统。

(3)Before you start with the procedure refer to Chapter 51-23-11 and determine the required paint build-up.

(3)在开始操作程序之前，请参考第51-23-11章，并确定所需的油漆积聚量。

(4)The following areas can be painted with chromate free external paint system:
(4)下列区域可用无铬外墙涂料系统涂刷:

Figure 018 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Customized Areas - Chromate Free Paint Scheme

(5)Refer to paragraph 14 . for radome painting.

本地采购100级，240级和320级

C.Repair

C.修复

(1)Perform a visual inspection of the fuselage external surface after stripping.

(1)剥离后，对机身外表面进行目视检查。

(2)Lightly abrade with SCOTCH-BRITE or abrasive paper grade 240 or finer.

(2)用SCOTCH-BRITE 或砂纸等级240或以上轻微研磨。

(3)Clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BBD1 or 08BAA9).
(3)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BBD1或08BAA9)清洁及除去表面的油脂。

NOTE: On anti-erosion coating (Material No. 04PAH3) use cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBD1) only.

注意: 在防腐蚀涂层(材料号04PAH3)上仅使用清洗剂(材料号08BBD1)。

(4)Mask off areas which will not be repainted, refer to paragraph 4..

(4)屏蔽掉不需要重新粉刷的区域，请参阅第(4)段

(5)Remove dirt on the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BBD1 or 08BAA9).
(5)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BBD1或08BAA9)清除表面污垢。

NOTE: Alternative solvent can be used, refer to AIMS 09-00-002.

提示: 可使用替代溶剂，请参阅 AIMS 09-00-002。

(6)If bare material is exposed or the basic primer is too thin (below 20 microns (787 microinches), refer to NTM Chapter 51-10-00 for coating thickness measurement), protect the exposed bare metal as follows:
(6)如裸露物料外露或基本底漆太薄(20微米以下(787微寸) ，有关测量涂层厚度的资料，请参阅 NTM 第51-10-00章) ，须按以下方法保护裸露的裸露金属:

-with chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1) and primer (Material No. 04EAC2 or 04DAB2), refer to Chapter 51-21-11, Paragraph 2.B or
- 使用化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1)和底漆(材料编号04EAC2或04DAB2) ，请参阅第51-21-11章第2段。B 或

-with wash primer (Material No. 04CMA2) and primer (Material No. 04EAC2).

- 使用清洗底漆(物料编号04CMA2)及底漆(物料编号04EAC2)。

NOTE: On titanium parts follow the same instructions but without the chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1), apply primer or wash primer within 4 hours after abrasion and cleaning.
注意: 对于钛合金零件，按照同样的说明，但不使用化学转化涂层(材料编号10ABC1) ，在磨损和清洗后4小时内涂上底漆或清洗底漆。

(7)Let the primer dry for 4 hours minimum at room temperature or up to the dry to sand time (refer to the material technical data sheet). If required feather the edge with fine abrasive paper or SCOTCH-BRITE, remove sanding residues and clean with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBD1 or 08BAA9 or 08BBF1)).

(7)让底漆在室温下至少干燥4小时，或直至干燥至出砂时间(参阅材料技术资料表)。如果需要，用细砂纸或 SCOTCH-BRITE 去除砂纸残留物，用清洁剂(材料编号08BBD1或08BAA9或08BBF1)清洁边缘。

(8)On composite parts requiring anti-static coating, renew the damaged anti-static coating in accordance with paragraph

  1. or paragraph 6..

(8)对需要防静电涂层的复合材料零件，按规定更换损坏的防静电涂层第5或者第6段。

(9)Apply primer (Material No. 04DCA3) to all surfaces (except the radome or anti-erosion coating (Material No. 04PAH3)).
(9)在所有表面涂上底漆(物料编号04DCA3)(天线罩或防腐蚀涂层(物料编号04PAH3)除外)。

NOTE: On radome or areas with anti-erosion coating (Material No. 04PAH3) apply only the finish, go on with step 17..C..(10).
提示:在天线罩或有抗侵蚀涂层(材料号04PAH3)的区域，只进行表面处理，继续步骤17..C..(10)。

NOTE: Mix Material No. 04DCA3 for 3 minutes at minimum.
提示:将04DCA3号物料混合至少3分钟。

NOTE: The fuselage skin and the ambient shop temperature must be above 20 °C (68.0 °F) during application and drying.

提示:在应用和干燥过程中，机身外壳和环境温度必须高于20°C(68.0°F)。

(10)Apply:
(10)申请:

-Top coat (Material No. 04JBA3) or
- 面层(物料编号04JBA3)或

-Base coat (Material No. 04LDA3) + clear coat (Material No. 04MDA3).
- 底漆(材料编号04LDA3) + 清漆(材料编号04MDA3)。

NOTE: Follow the manufacturer’s data sheet for over coating time.

提示: 根据制造商的数据表超过涂层时间。

(11)Remove the masking.

(11)取下遮蔽物。

(12)If required, renew the external marking in accordance with AMM Chapter 11-20-00.
(12)如有需要，按照 AMM 第11-20-00章的规定更换外部标记。

NOTE: Technical marking made from Material No. 05VGM3can be installed between base coat (after a minimum cure time of 6h) and the clear coat.
提示：用05VGM3材料制成的技术标志可以安装在底漆(最短固化时间为6小时)和清漆之间。

18.Renewal of External Finish on Avionics Ventilation Skin Temperature Sensor

18. 更新航空电子通风表面温度传感器外饰

A.General

(1)This procedure is applicable after complete paint stripping in accordance with Chapter 51-75-11.

(1)按照第51-75-11章的规定，本程序适用于完成油漆剥离后。

(2)The work consists in applying an external paint scheme after removal of external paint on skin temperature sensor 28 HQ, refer to Figure 019.
(2)这项工作包括在去除28 HQ, 皮肤温度传感器上的外部涂料后，应用外部涂料方案，参见图019。

NOTE: Make sure, that paint thickness does not exceed requirements.

提示: 确保涂料厚度不超过要求。

Figure 019 / 51-75-12 (sheet 1) Skin Temperature Sensor 28 HQ

B.Materials

B.维修材料

ITEM
项目		NOMENCLATURE
物品		QTY
数量		MATERIAL/REMARKS
资料/备注
-Cleaning agent
清洁剂		ARMaterial No. 08BBF1 or 08BBD1 or 08BAA9 (Refer to CML)
物料编号08BBF1或08BBD1或08BAA9(请参阅 CML)
-Chemical conversion coatingARMaterial No. 10ABC1 (Refer to CML)
物料编号10ABC1(请参阅 CML)
-Polyurethane primer
聚氨酯底漆		ARMaterial No. 04EAC2 (Refer to CML)
物料编号04EAC2(请参阅 CML)
-Epoxy primer
环氧面漆		ARMaterial No. 04DAB2 (Refer to CML)
物料编号04DAB2(参阅 CML)
-Polyurethane top coat
聚氨酯面漆		ARMaterial No. 04JME4 or 04JAA3 grey bac 707 (Refer to CML)
材料编号04JME4或04JAA3灰色 bac 707(参阅 CML)
-SCOTCH-BRITE
百洁布		ARLocal purchase
本地采购
-Masking Tape
遮蔽胶带		ARLocal purchase
本地采购
-Masking Paper
遮蔽纸		ARLocal purchase
本地采购

C.Repair

C.修复

(1)Remove top coat and primer in accordance with Chapter 51-75-11.

(1)按照第51-75-11章的规定拆卸面漆和底漆。

(2)Lightly abrade with SCOTCH-BRITE or abrasive paper grade 240 or finer.

(2)用SCOTCH-BRITE 或砂纸等级240或以上轻微研磨。

(3)Clean and degrease the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BBD1 or 08BAA9).
(3)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BBD1或08BAA9)清洁及除去表面的油脂。

NOTE: Alternative solvent can be used, refer to AIMS 09-00-002.

注: 可使用替代溶剂，请参阅 AIMS 09-00-002。

(4)Mask off areas which will not be repainted, refer to paragraph 4..
(4)屏蔽掉不需要重新粉刷的区域，参见第4段。

(5)Remove dirt on the surface with cleaning agent (Material No. 08BBF1 or 08BBD1 or 11-0206)

(5)用清洁剂(物料编号08BBF1或08BBD1或11-0206)清除表面的污垢

(6)If bare metal is exposed, protect exposed bare metal with chemical conversion coating (Material No. 10ABC1).
(6)如果裸露金属，用化学转化涂层(材料号10ABC1)保护裸露金属。

NOTE: Apply the primer within 4 hours after abrasion and cleaning.
注意: 在磨损和清洁后4小时内涂抹底漆。

(7)Apply primer (Material No. 04EAC2 or 04DAB2), dry film thickness.

(7)应用底漆(材料编号04EAC2或04DAB2) ，干膜厚度。

(8)Apply top coat (Material No. 04JME4 or 04JAA3 grey bac 707).

(8)涂上面层(材料编号04JME4或04JAA3灰色 bac 707)。

(9)Remove masking.

(9)拆除遮蔽物。

entry.title: AIRBUS章节号51-75-00
entry.content:
51-75-00 - Description - PAINT REPAIR

51-75-00 -描述-油漆修补

1.General

A.This section gives an overview about the paint removal and paint coating repair procedures.

本节概述了油漆去除和油漆涂层修补程序。

2.Procedures

A.Information about chemical paint stripping and paint removal by abrasion is given in Chapter 51-75-11.

a .关于化学油漆脱漆和油漆磨损去除的信息在[第51-75-11章]

B.Chapter 51-75-12 contains information about the repairs of paint coating.
第51-75-12章包含有关油漆涂层修复的信息。

entry.title: AIRBUS章节号51-76-12
entry.content:
51-76-12 - Description - REPAIR OF FUEL TANK SEALING

51-76-12 - 描述-油箱密封的修复

WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE CONSUMABLE MATERIALS. OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER INSTRUCTIONS AND YOUR LOCAL REGULATIONS.

WARNING: YOU MUST OBEY ALL THE APPLICABLE FUEL SAFETY PROCEDURES GIVEN IN AMM CHAPTER 28-00-00-03 CONF 00. FOR WORK IN THE FUEL TANKS, REFER TO THE FUEL SAFETY PROCEDURES GIVEN IN AMM CHAPTER 28-10-00-03 CONF 00.

WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO WORK IN OR NEAR A FUEL TANK, MAKE SURE THAT YOU OBEY ALL THE SAFETY PROCEDURES. THIS WILL PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE AIRCRAFT.

WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO WORK ON THE FUEL SYSTEM, MAKE SURE THAT YOU OBEY THE FUEL SAFETY PROCEDURES. THIS WILL PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE AIRCRAFT.

CAUTION: DO NOT USE METAL TOOLS TO REMOVE THE UNWANTED MATERIAL. METAL TOOLS CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE SURFACE OF THE COMPONENT.

CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT YOU REMOVE ALL MASKING MATERIAL FROM THE REPAIR AREA WHEN THE WORK IS COMPLETED. IT IS VERY IMPORTANT TO MAKE SURE THAT THERE IS NO MASKING MATERIAL ON THE PITOT PROBE HEADS AND STATIC PORTS.

1.Task Supporting Data

A.General

(1) One of the properties of aircraft fuel is that it can flow easily through very small openings. Thus the aircraft structure in which the fuel is kept is sealed to prevent leakage.

(2) If the sealant in these areas is damaged or becomes defective, a fuel leakage may occur, this can be dangerous. When a leak occurs, you must only use the correct sealants and procedures for the necessary repair.

(3) This task gives you the information necessary to do a permanent repair to stop a leakage of fuel. The information for a temporary repair, for which it is not necessary to go into the tank is given in the AMM Chapter 51-76-12.

(4) Fuel leak reporting

When reporting a fuel leak to AIRBUS, please use the fuel leak reporting form, given in Figure 010.

B. Area of Applicability

This paragraph is intentionally left blank.

C. Weight Variant Applicability

This task is applicable to all weight variants listed in the SRM Introduction for the related aircraft.

D. Limits/Restrictions

This paragraph is intentionally left blank.

E. Repair Category

This paragraph is intentionally left blank.

F. Inspections

This paragraph is intentionally left blank.

G. Job Set-Up Information

(1) Material Reference:

(a) Consumable list

The information in Table 1 is given for guidance only; the information given in the Manufacturer’s Data Sheets has precedence. Please refer to the CML for complete and up to date information concerning the products that are under a given application code.

APPLICATION CODEAPPLICATION NAMEMATERIAL NAMECOMMENTS(REFER TO CML)
06ABA1Polysulfide Sealant − Fuel Tank BrushableMC-238 A 1/2with MC-110
MC-238 A 2with MC-110
MC-238 A 4with MC-110
PR 1440 A 1/2with PR 148 AF
PR 1440 A 2with PR 148 AF
PS 890 A 1/2
PS 890 A 2
PR 1422 A 1/2 NAwith PR 148 AF or PR 184
PR 1422 A 2 NAwith PR 148 AF or PR 184
06ABB1Polysulfide Sealant − Fuel Tank FilletPR-2001 B 1/2with PR 187
PR-2001 B 2with PR 187
PR-2001 B 4with PR 187
MC-238 B 1/2with MC−110
MC-238 B 2with MC-110
MC-238 B 4with MC-110
PR 1440 B 1/2with PR 148 AF
PR 1440 B 2with PR 148 AF
PS 890 B 1/2
PS 890 B 2
PS 890 B 4
PR 1422 B 1/2 NAwith PR 148 AF or PR 184
PR 1422 B 2 NAwith PR 148 AF or PR 184
06ABF1Polysulfide Sealant − Fuel Tank Quick CuringMC-238 B 1/2with MC-110
MC-238 B 2with MC-110
MC-238 B 4with MC-110
PR-2001 B 1/2with PR 187
PR-2001 B 2with PR 187
PR-2001 B 4with PR 187
PR 1828 B 1/4with PR 186
PR 1828 B 2with PR 186
PR 1826 B 1/4with PR 186
PR 1826 B 1/2with PR 186
PR 1826 B 2with PR 186
PS 860 B 1/6with PR 148
04DAB2Primer Epoxy Paint − Corrosion Inhibiting StructurePR 205
Aerodur HS Primer 37092
08BBF1Non Aqueous Cleaner − Methyl−Ethyl−KetoneMEK
864400DIESTONE DLS

Table 1 - Consumable List

(b) Equipment and Materials

The list which follows gives you the equipment and other materials which you need to make a good repair.

ITEMNOMENCLATUREQTYMATERIAL/REMARKS
1Sealant Removal Tools (Non-Metallic Scrapers)ARMade from hard wood, plastic or laminated fibre block, refer to Figure 002
2A Pneumatic Tool Kit−RDS (Rapid Desealing System), refer to Figure 002
3Sealant Shaping ToolsARMade from 6.5 mm (0.256 in) diameter bronze or soft steel weldind rod, refer to Figure 001
4BrushesARWith short nylon bristles
5Rubber GlovesAR−
6Clean Air MaskAR−
7Clean Lint-Free ClothAR−
8Extrusion GunARFor bead application
9SpatulasAR−
10Abrasive PadsAR−
11Non Aqueous Cleaner - Methyl-Ethyl-Ketone−Material No. 08BBF1 or product code 864400 (Refer to CML)
12Spark Proof LampAR−
13Collapsible Aluminum TubesARItems 13 and 14 are used together to apply sealant to nuts or bolt heads, refer to Figure 008
14ApplicatorARItems 13 and 14 are used together to apply sealant to nuts or bolt heads, refer to Figure 008
-Polysulfide Sealant - Fuel Tank BrushableARMaterial No. 06ABA1 (Refer to CML)
-Polysulfide Sealant - Fuel Tank FilletARMaterial No. 06ABB1 (Refer to CML)
-Polysulfide Sealant - Fuel Tank Quick CuringARMaterial No. 06ABF1 (Refer to CML)
-Primer Epoxy Paint - Corrosion Inhibiting StructureARMaterial No. 04DAB2 (Refer to CML)

For information about the repair materials, repair materials uses and mixing of sealants refer to the repair instruction or Chapter 51-76-00 (using sealant for fuel applications).

NOTE: The applicators CHS 483/1 or /2 are available from:

Airbus UK,

BROUGHTON,

Great Britain.

(2) References:

Chapter 51-24-00

Chapter 51-40-00

Chapter 51-76-00

Chapter 51-76-11

AMM Chapter 28-00-00-03 CONF 00

AMM Chapter 28-10-00

AMM Chapter 28-10-00-03 CONF 00

AMM Chapter 28-11-00

AMM Chapter 28-11-00-05 CONF 00

AMM Chapter 28-11-00-790-009

AMM Chapter 51-76-12

Procedure

A. Repair of Fuel Tank Sealing

NOTE: For specific fuel leak repairs, refer to Paragraph 2..A..(5).

(1) The Source of the Fuel Leakage

(a) You are recommended to use the procedures given in the AMM Chapter 28-11-00-05 CONF 00 - Tanks - Adjustment/Test to find the source.

(b) When you have found the area which is the source of the fuel leakage, you must examine it carefully. You must find if the cause of the leakage is:

-failed or damaged sealant

-a structural problem, such as a crack, or a fastener which has failed.

If a structural problem is the cause of the leakage, you must repair it before you repair the sealant.

(2) Removal of Damaged Sealant

CAUTION: DO NOT USE A METAL SCRAPER TO REMOVE THE UNWANTED MATERIAL. A METAL SCRAPER CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE SURFACE OF THE COMPONENT.

(a) When you have found the area which is the source of the fuel leakage (Refer to Paragraph 2..A..(1)

), you must carefully remove all the damaged sealant. When you remove the damaged sealant, take care not to cause damage to the structure. Use a non−metallic scraper made from hard wood, plastic or laminated fibre block (Refer to Sheet

1). As an alternative removal procedure it is recommended to use a pneumatic tool with a vibrating cutting blade made of teak peek (Refer to Sheet 2).

For this specific tool refer to manufacturer instructions:

-Tool Kit RDS

SUNAERO

70 Rue Ampere − BP58

Z.I Lyon Nord

69726 Genay Cedex

France

www.sunaero.com

NOTE: Remove sealant particles and inspect visually the surface protection of the structure.

(b) If the surface protection on the structure is damaged, you must repair it before you repair the seal (Refer to Chapter 51-24-00 for the applicable procedure).

NOTE: If it is necessary to renew the surface protection, the new protection must be allowed to cure before applying sealant. After protection curing it is necessary to abrade the protection lightly to improve sealant adhesion.

(3) Cleaning the Repair Area

(a) It is very important that the area which you will seal is clean before you apply the sealant. You must wear clean gloves on your hand if it is necessary to touch a surface which you have cleaned. Make sure that the tools you use to apply the sealant are clean before you start.

(b) To clean an area you must put sufficient non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or product code 864400) on a lint-free cloth to make the cloth moist. Only use the minimum quantity necessary or you can cause damage to the paint. Also clean an area of at least 50 mm (1.97 in) around the repair area.

(c) After cleaning wait 15−20 minutes to allow the surface of the area to return to ambient temperature. After that, wipe the surface with a clean dry cloth to remove any condensation.

(4) The Use of Sealants

(a) General

CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN THE FUEL TANK IS OPEN. DO NOT LET SEALANT OR OTHER UNWANTED MATERIAL GET INTO THE FUEL AND/OR AIR PASSAGES IN THE FUEL TANK.

1 To make or to repair a seal with sealant, it is very important that you use the correct procedures. If you do not, another leakage could occur. In the steps which follow you are given the general procedure to use when you apply sealants. You must use this procedure together with the applicable repair procedure.

a You must lightly abrade all surfaces. This will help the sealant to make a good bond.

NOTE: The above mentioned step is not necessary, if the surfaces have a new layer of paint or primer (Refer to Paragraph

2..A..(2).(b) ).

b The use of adhesion promoter is necessary, if the CML application code providing the sealant calls also an adhesion promoter. This will promote good sealant adhesion and therefore reduce the risk of a further leakage occurring.

c You must put a cover over mixed sealant when it is not in use.

d

You must discard sealant when its “application life” expires and it has started to cure. Do not try to make it thin.

e If you have kept mixed sealant in a refrigerator, remove it from the refrigerator and let it get to “room temperature” before you use it. Do not put unwanted sealant back into the refrigerator.

(b) Local and General Internal Repair (Refer to Figure 003).

1 The repair that follows is suitable for a quick permanent repair when a leak occurs from a seam, channel or a fastener.

a Observe all relevant safety precautions and procedures before entering the tank (Refer to AMM Chapter 28-10-00).

b Do a leak path analysis to determine the cause of the leak.

c Remove sealant from the affected area using a non-metallic scraper.

d Clean the exposed surfaces with a lint-free cloth moistened with non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or product code 864400).

e Inspect the area for cracks and other defects.

NOTE: Any defects found must be repaired at this stage.

f With a sealant gun or spatula, apply a bead of polysulfide sealant (Material No. 06ABF1) to the seam, channel or fastener. Press the bead of sealant firmly into the seam or channel and around any fastener.

Make sure that a smooth fillet, free from air bubbles, is formed. Overlap existing sealant.

g Make sure that the inside of the tank is clear of all unwanted materials and that all tools and equipment have been removed.

h Close the tank, refuel fully and check for leaks.

NOTE: If no barrier coating has been used, allow time to partially cure the sealant before refuelling.

(c) Sealing of Nuts and Bolts

1 General

a All the nuts, or the heads of the bolts which are on the inner side of the fuel tanks must have seals. Usually each one is sealed on its own in the tank. If a leakage occurs from a bolt, do not try to tighten the bolt, this will usually make the leakage worse. You must remove the nut and the bolt and install new ones. If the original bolt was an interference fit you must replace it with an applicable oversize bolt, (Refer to Chapter 51-40-00 for the details on fastener installation and removal, applicable oversize bolts and torque values). To seal the new nut and bolt, do the applicable procedure from those which follow:

2 Self-sealing nuts (Refer to Figure 004)

a If the nut is installed without a washer, you do not have to put sealant around the nut. But you must do the procedure which follows on the thread of the bolt which is above the nut.

After you have installed the nut, clean the protruding thread of the bolt with non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or product code 864400).

Paint the thread of the bolt with primer epoxy paint (Material No. 04DAB2) or apply a layer of polysulfide sealant (Material No. 06ABA1).

b If the nut is installed with a washer between the nut and the structure, you must do the procedure which follows:

Clean the face of structure where the washer will touch (Refer to Paragraph

2..A..(3) ).

Prepare the polysulfide sealant (Material No.

06ABA1

or Material No.

06ABB1

), refer to Paragraphs

1..G..(1).(b)

and

2..A..(4).(a)

. Apply a layer of polysulfide sealant (Material No.

06ABA1

or Material No.

06ABB1

) to the cleaned structure face.

Assemble the washer and the nut on the bolt. When you tighten the nut, make a bead around the washer with sealant which is pushed out. After that do the steps that follow:

-Clean the face of structure where the washer will touch, refer to Paragraph

2..A..(3)

-

Prepare the polysulfide sealant (Material No.

06ABA1

or Material No.

06ABB1

), refer to Paragraphs

1..G..(1).(b)

and

2..A..(4).(a)

.

NOTE: In the above paragraphs, wet install the bolts (Refer to Figure 004).

3 Non self-sealing nuts and bolt heads

a You must do the procedure which follows if the nut and bolt assembly does not use a self-sealing nut:

- Clean the area around the hole through where you will put the bolt (Refer to Paragraph

2..A..(3)

). Do this on the inner and outer side of the tank structure.

-Prepare the polysulfide sealant (Material No.

06ABA1

or Material No.

06ABB1

), refer to Paragraphs

1..G..(1).(b)

and

2..A..(4).(a)

.

-Apply the polysulfide sealant (Material No. 06ABA1 or Material No. 06ABB1) to the shank and under the head of the bolt. Install the bolt.

-Apply a layer of the polysulfide sealant (Material No. 06ABA1 or Material No. 06ABB1) to the structure face where the washer or nut will touch.

-Install the nut (or nut and washer if applicable) and tighten the nut. Make a bead with the sealant that is pushed out around the bolt head and the washer or nut.

-Clean the nut, washer, bolt threads and the adjacent area with non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or product code 864400). Make sure that you remove all signs of lubricant and fuel.

-Apply a coating of adhesion promoter if required over all of the area with a brush or lint-free cloth, thoroughly scrub the surfaces. Wipe off the area while it is still wet with a clean cloth. Allow the area to dry for 30 minutes. It is necessary to repeat this step if the sealant is not applied within 4 hours.

-On the inner side of the tank, put a cover of the polysulfide sealant (Material No. 06ABA1) over the bolt heads or nuts and washers (Refer to Figure 009). To do this you can use the applicator with a collapsible aluminum tube or an extrusion gun with an extension tube. If the access to the bolt head or nut is not easy, you can use a brush to apply the sealant. But make sure that you get a good seal, especially where the threads of the bolt go into the nut.

(d) Bead Repair (Refer to Figure 005).

1 Riveted or bolted joints are usually sealed with a bead of sealant along the edge of the joint. Do the procedure which follows to repair a leak at one of these type of joints.

a Remove the damaged sealant (Refer to Paragraph

2..A..(2)

).

NOTE: Remove the sealant for a minimum distance of 75 mm (2.95 in) from each side of the damaged area or the area of the leakage source (Refer to Figure 005).

b Make a chamfer on each end of the remaining sealant. Make the faces of the chamfer rough.

c Clean the repair area (Refer to Paragraph

2..A..(3)

).

d Apply a coating of adhesion if required over all of the area with a brush or lint-free cloth, thoroughly scrub the surfaces. Wipe off the area while it is still wet with a clean cloth. Allow the area to dry as per TDS data.

e Prepare the sealant, refer to Paragraphs

1..G..(1).(b)

and

2..A..(4).(a)

.

f Apply a continuous bead of sealant to the repair area. Make an overlap at a minimum of 12 mm (0.47 in) on the remaining sealant. You can apply the sealant with a spatula or an extrusion gun (Refer to Figure 006). Make sure that all the sealant makes a good bond with the structure and the remaining sealant. Make sure that there are no air−bubbles in the bead. Make the bead the shape and dimensions (refer to Figure 005).

(e) Structural Repairs (Refer to Figure 007)

1 When you do a repair to replace a part of the structure of the fuel tanks, you must fully seal the structure. The steps which follow will help you to make a good seal:

a Remove the remaining sealant from around the area for a minimum distance of 75 mm (2.95 in) (Refer to Paragraph

2..A..(2)

).

b Clean all the mating faces (Refer to Paragraph

2..A..(3)

).

c Apply adhesion promoter if required, refer to Paragraph

2..A..(4).(d).1.e

.

d Prepare the sealant, refer to Paragraphs

1..G..(1).(b)

and

2..A..(4).(a)

.

e Apply a layer of sealant to the faying surfaces. The layer must be larger than the mating area by a minimum of 12 mm (0.47 in). It must also be thick enough to ensure that the sealant will be dispersed all around the repair, but not cause buckling of thin parts.

f Assemble the repair pieces or the new part into their correct position as soon as you have applied the sealant on them.

g Put the applicable fasteners into the repair (or the new part) immediately. If this is not possible you must use screw-pins or clamps to hold the pieces tightly in their correct position. When you make this assembly, it is correct when sealant is pushed out along all the lengths of the joint. If it is not, you must make the joints again with more sealant.

NOTE: You must install the fasteners in this repair “wet”. If the fasteners are nuts and bolts, refer to Paragraph

2..A..(4).(c).1

. If the fasteners are rivets, refer to

Chapter 51-76-11

.

h

Make a smooth bead with the sealant which is pushed out along the length of the joints. Make sure there are no air-bubbles in this bead. If it is necessary, you can apply a second layer of sealant to make the bead the correct dimensions (Refer to Paragraph

2..A..(4).(d)

).

i After the sealant has cured for half of its tack-free time (Refer to the manufacturer’s leaflet), prepare the overcoat polysulfide sealant (Material No.

06ABA1

), refer to Paragraphs

2..A..(4).(a)

and

1..G..(1).(b)

.

j Use a brush to apply a layer of the polysulfide sealant (Material No.

06ABA1

) over the joint area, refer to Figure

007

. This layer must be a continuous layer with no air-bubbles in it. It must be larger than the bead sealant by a minimum of 12 mm (0.47 in). You must also apply this sealant to all the rivet heads. For the procedure to seal bolt heads or nuts, refer to Paragraph

2..A..(4).(c).1

.

k When all the sealant has cured for the necessary time (Refer to the manufacturer’s leaflet), you must do the test for fuel leaks, refer to AMM Chapter 28-11-00.

(5) Specific Fuel Leak Repairs

(a) For specific fuel leak repairs contact AIRBUS.

(6) Quick Curing Sealant Device

NOTE: Obey the related repair procedures and safety precautions, given in this section, carefully.

(a) The new sealant must have the correct state of cure before the refuelling starts. If possible, the sealant should cure to a hardness of 35 Shore A. To determine what this cure time is, the operator takes a test sample and uses a hardness gage to measure the period of time necessary to get a hardness of 35 shore A.

To date and for practical purposes, AIRBUS recommends that the time before refuelling should be the shortest of:

-A minimum of two times the tack free time (the tack free time is the time necessary for the sealant to become “touch dry “)

-the cure time.

The tack free time and the cure time decrease as the temperature increases. AIRBUS thus investigated different devices to increase and control the temperature in the repair area (50° C (122° F) maximum). Devices such as hot air blowers, infra-red lamps and thermoreactor technology, which uses catalytic combustion can be used.

Refer to Chapter 51-76-00 for description and information on the thermoreactor.

For specific device information refer to supplier address:

-SUNAERO

70 Rue Ampere − BP58

Z.I Lyon Nord

69726 Genay Cedex

France

www.sunaero.com

(7) Helium Detection Procedure

(a) For the helium detection procedure, refer to false TASK Chapter 28−11−00-790-009.

(8) Fuel Leak Reporting Form

(a) Refer to Figure 010.

Figure 001 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Example of Sealant Shaping Tool

Figure 002 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Sealant Removal with a Non-Metallic Scraper

Figure 002 / 51-76-12 (sheet 2) Sealant Removal with a Pneumatic Tool RDS 07B

Figure 003 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Sealant Application

Figure 004 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Sealing Self - Sealing Nuts

Figure 005 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Example of a Bead Repair

Figure 005 / 51-76-12 (sheet 2) Example of a Bead Repair

Figure 006 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Using an Extrusion Gun

Figure 007 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Sealing a Typical Repair

Figure 008 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Sealant Tools

Figure 009 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Resealing Techniques for Typical Fasteners

Figure 010 / 51-76-12 (sheet 1) Fuel Leak Reporting Form

Figure 010 / 51-76-12 (sheet 2) Fuel Leak Reporting Form

Figure 010 / 51-76-12 (sheet 3) Fuel Leak Reporting Form

entry.title: AIRBUS章节号51-76-11
entry.content:
51-76-11 - Description - REPAIR OF SEALING EXCLUDING FUEL TANK

51-76-11 -描述-密封件的维修，不包括燃料箱

WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE CONSUMABLE MATERIALS. OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER INSTRUCTIONS AND YOUR LOCAL REGULATIONS.

CAUTION: DO NOT USE METAL TOOLS TO REMOVE THE UNWANTED MATERIAL. METAL TOOLS CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE SURFACE OF THE COMPONENT.

1.General

A.This task tells you how to repair a seal when it becomes necessary. Figure 001shows you some examples of the use of sealants. The task is divided into these parts:

-General,

-Safety Precautions,

-Repair Procedures.

B.The Repair Procedures are divided into:

-General,

-Fastener Sealing,

-Anchor Nut Sealing,

-Sealing Gaps and Cavities,

-Interfaying Surface Seal,

-How to Make and Repair a Bead Seal.

2.Safety Precautions

A.Sealants and their related materials are usually made from chemicals. These chemicals can release dangerous gases that can cause damage to the eyes, the lungs and the skin. When you use these materials, obey these warnings:

WARNING: OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S INSTRUCTIONS WHEN YOU USE CLEANING AGENTS, ADHESIVES, SEALANTS AND PAINTS. THESE MATERIALS ARE DANGEROUS.

WARNING: OBEY THE MANUFACTURER INSTRUCTIONS WHEN YOU USE THE CLEANING AGENTS (MATERIAL NO. 08BBF1). THESE CLEANING AGENTS ARE DANGEROUS.

WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU APPLY CHROMIC ACID ANODIZING (CAA) AND CHEMICAL CONVERSION COATING. THE CHEMICALS USED ARE POISONOUS AND CAN CAUSE INJURY. SEE THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS.

CAUTION: ENSURE THAT ALL MASKING MATERIALS ARE REMOVED FROM THE REPAIR AREA ON COMPLETION OF WORK, PAY SPECIAL ATTENTION TO PITOT HEADS AND STATIC PORTS.

B. When you do repair work with sealants in a closed area, you must also take these precautions:

-Use air circulation equipment, or a clean-air mask,

-Use a safety man to monitor you while you are in the closed area. The safety man must, if possible, be outside the closed area, but he must be able to see and talk to you,

-Do not smoke, or use open lamps in the closed or adjacent areas,

- You must only use approved flame-proof lamps fitted with bulbs of 40 watts or less,

-Before you do a repair in an area near a moving part or an electrical circuit, safety the system or electrical circuits.

Figure 001 / 51-76-11 (sheet 1) Examples of the Use of Sealants

C.Before you do any work with sealants or their related materials, you must ground this equipment:

-the structure,

-the extrusion gun,

-the air circulation line,

-metal parts of the clean-air mask,

-flame proof lamps.

You must measure the ground points before you use them. You do this to make sure they have the correct conductivity.

3.Repair Materials

ITEMNOMENCLATUREQTYMATERIAL/REMARKS
-Sealant Removal Tools (scrapers)ARMade locally from hard wood, plastic or fiber block, dimensions and shape must be satisfactory for the work
-Non Aqueous Cleaner - Methyl-Ethyl-KetoneARMaterial No. 08BBF1 (Refer to CML)
-DIESTONE DLSARMaterial No. 864400 (Refer to CML)
-Coating - Flexible StructureARMaterial No. 04QAB2 (Refer to CML)
-Butyl AlcoholARLocal purchase
-Emery ClothARDifferent grades required which are satisfactory for the work
-SpatulasARDifferent dimensions and shapes are necessary which are satisfactory for the work
-Brushes-
-Extrusion Gun-
-Spray Equipment-
-Polysulfide Sealant - General Purpose InterfayARMaterial No. 06AAC1 (Refer to CML)
-Polysulfide Sealant - Low Density Multi Purpose InterfayARMaterial No. 06ACC1 (Refer to CML)
-Polysulfide Sealant - Fuel Tank InterfayARMaterial No. 06ABC1 (Refer to CML)

NOTE: The sealants necessary for the general repairs in this task are not given. The applicable sealant must agree with different conditions and will be given in a repair procedure via the new CML code. Correspondence to product can be found in the CML.

4.Repair Procedures

A.General

(1) Put masking tape around the damaged sealant. You do this to prevent damage to the undamaged sealant and the adjacent structure.

(2) Use nonmetallic scrapers and a stiff brush to remove the damaged sealant.

(3) Chamfer the ends of the remaining sealant to give a minimum taper of 13 mm (0.512 in). Refer to Figure 002. Make the faces of the tapers rough.

NOTE: The tapers give a good overlap for the new sealant to bond onto the remaining sealant.

(4) Clean the repair area with the non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or 864400). Use as little non aqueous cleaner as possible to clean the area. Dry the area immediately with a clean dry cloth.

CAUTION: IF YOU MUST DO ANY REPAIR WORK IN THE STEP BELOW, A PERIOD OF 8 HOURS IS NECESSARY BEFORE YOU CAN DO THE SEALANT REPAIR.

(5) Do an inspection of the repair area to see if the protective finish is damaged. Repair it, if it is damaged. Refer to Chapter 51-23-00 for the repair information.

(6) Prepare the correct sealant. Put a layer of the sealant on the repair area. Use a spatula or extrusion gun to do this. Make sure that there are no air bubbles under the sealant. Make sure that the sealant has made a good bond at the overlaps.

(7) Apply the correct protective layer to the sealant, if necessary (Refer to Chapter 51-23-12).

Figure 002 / 51-76-11 (sheet 1) Example of Steps in a Bead Repair

B.Fastener Sealing (Refer to Figure 003)

(1) This procedure is applicable to solid rivets.

(a) Clean the area you want to seal with the non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or 864400).

(b) Apply a layer of the sealant to the inside face of the hole. Make a small bead of the sealant around the edge of the hole. If the rivet is a countersink type, apply a layer of the sealant to the face of the dimple or countersink in the structure.

NOTE: When the upset head of a rivet is made, the shank of the rivet will expand. This effect will make a seal in the structure.

(2) This procedure is applicable to clearance and/or transition fit fasteners, for example, HI-LOK and swaged pins.

CAUTION: DO NOT CLEAN THESE TYPES OF FASTENERS, OR THEIR COLLARS. THEY HAVE A SPECIAL LUBRICANT ON THEM WHICH IS IMPORTANT FOR THEIR CORRECT ASSEMBLY.

(a)Clean the area you want to seal with the non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or 864400).

(b) Apply a layer of the sealant to the plain part of the pin shank and the underface of the head.

NOTE: Make sure that sealant does not get on the threads or serrations of the pin.

(c) Install the pin and its collar.

(d) Apply a layer of sealant to the broken end of the collar or pin, if required.

(e) Remove unwanted sealant from the repair area.

(f) Clean the repair area with the non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or 864400).

(g) Apply the correct surface protection to the pin head, collar and threaded area. Refer to Chapter 51-75-12.

(3) This procedure is applicable to interference fit bolts.

(a) Clean the area you want to seal with the non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or 864400).

(b) Apply a layer of sealant to the surface of the repair materials that the set head of the bolt will contact.

NOTE: Make sure that sealant does not get on the threads or serrations of the pin.

(c) Install the pin and its collar.

Figure 003 / 51-76-11 (sheet 1) Examples of Procedures Used to Prevent Leaks

(d) Apply a layer of sealant to the broken end of the collar or pin, if necessary.

(e) Remove unwanted sealant from the repair area.

(f) Clean the repair area with the non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or 864400).

(g) Apply the correct surface protection to the pin head, collar and threaded area. Refer to Chapter 51-75-12.

C. Anchor Nut Sealing

(1) After you have installed the anchor nut, clean the anchor nut and the adjacent area with the non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or 864400).

(2) Apply a layer of sealant to the anchor nut and the adjacent structure. Refer to Figure 003.

NOTE: If the anchor nut is a two-part type, the sealant must include all the anchor nut. If the anchor nut is a cap-type, it is only necessary to include the base.

D. Sealing Gaps and Cavities

For seal the limits to gaps and cavities in external surfaces refer to Chapter 51-10-00.

E. Interfaying Surface Seal (Refer to Figure 004)

When you repair the structure, it is usually necessary to make a seal between the parts (Interfaying Seal). The steps below give the general procedure if it is not given in the repair procedure.

NOTE: When possible, you must do all machining steps (for example, drilling and reaming) before you apply the sealant. If this is not possible, make sure that the repair pieces are clamped together tightly when you do the machining steps. This will prevent a bad seal caused by swarf in the joint. Only use sharp tools and a light pressure when you do the machining steps.

(1) Lightly make the mating faces rough.

NOTE: It is not necessary to do step (1) if the paint or primer on these faces is new.

NOTE: Alternatively you can use adhesive promoter (Refer to CML for product reference if required as per selected sealant and wait for the necessary time before sealant application).

(2) Clean the mating faces with the non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or 864400).

(3)With a spatula, or extrusion gun, apply a layer of sealant onto the mating face of the smaller part to be joined. Use a grooved roller, or a serrated plastic tool to get an equal level of sealant on the required mating face. The thickness of the applied sealant must be approximately 0.5 mm (0.020 in).

NOTE: Take care not to make air bubbles in the sealant.

For thick parts (above 2.5 mm (0.1 in) thick) attached with fasteners with a pitch greater than 5 x d (in mating face), you must use only Class C polysulfide sealant (Material No. 06AAC1, Material No. 06ACC1, Material No. 06ABC1) applied with roller to a thickness of 0.15 mm (0.006 in) to 0.38 mm (0.015 in).

(4) Assemble the repair pieces into their correct position. Make sure that no air is included in the joint and that sealant is subsequently squeezed out (for information: remaining thickness is approximately ≤ 0.2 mm (0.008 in), refer to Figure 008).

NOTE: Make the layer of sealant applied in step (3) thicker if the repair pieces must touch when they are moved into their positions.

Figure 004 / 51-76-11 (sheet 1) Examples of an Interfay Seal

(5) Use clamps or screw pins to hold the repair pieces in their positions.

For thick parts (above 2.5 mm (0.1 in) thick) attached with fasteners with a pitch greater than 5 x d (in mating face) install clamps or screw pins in every hole available starting from center then outward, refer to Figure 009. Adjust the clamping force to ensure a minimum gap at fastener hole, refer to Figure 008.

(6) Make sure that a continuous bead of sealant has been pushed out around all the edges of the repair parts.

NOTE: This will show you if a good seal has been made.

(7) Install the correct fasteners or rivets. Install them wet (Refer to Paragraph

4..B. unless it is specified differently in the repair procedure.

NOTE: This step must be done before the work life of the sealant has expired (Refer to Chapter 51-76-00).

(8) Fasteners which are torqued (refer to Chapter 51-49-00) when they are installed (for example, TAPER-LOK fasteners), must be re-torqued. Do this 30 minutes after they were installed. If there are more than two pieces in the repair joint, do the retorquing every 30 minutes until the fasteners are correctly torqued.

(9) Make the unwanted sealant into a bead around the joint edges (Refer to Paragraph

  1. Do this before the sealant has cured.

NOTE: A repair procedure may specify that unwanted sealant must be removed from a repair. The repair procedure must be obeyed.

(10) Cover the repair area with a polythene sheet to keep the sealant clean until it has cured.

(11) Apply the correct surface protection to the repair area (Refer to Chapter 51-75-12). If necessary, apply a protective layer to the sealant.

F. How to Make and Repair a Bead Seal (Refer to Figure 004, Figure 005, Figure 006 and Figure 007)

You must make a bead of sealant along the edges of a repair (or parts of the structure), if it is specified. The steps below give you the general procedure to do this, and to help repair a damaged bead.

(1) Clean the repair area with the non aqueous cleaner (Material No. 08BBF1 or 864400).

(2) Do the repair or assembly.

(3) Push the sealant tightly into any corners. Make sure that all air- bubbles are pushed out. Make sure that a good adhesion is made between the sealant and the faces.

NOTE: You can use a spatula or extrusion gun to apply the sealant.

(4) Make the sealant into a bead of the correct dimensions (Refer to Figure 005).

NOTE: A large bead must be made in layers. Each layer must be put on before the other has cured.

(5) Cover the repair with a polythene sheet to keep the sealant clean until it has cured.

(6) Apply the correct surface protection to the repair area (Refer to Chapter 51-75-12). If it is necessary, apply a flexible protective layer to the sealant (Material No. 04QAB2).

Figure 005 / 51-76-11 (sheet 1) Bead Data

Figure 006 / 51-76-11 (sheet 1) How to lead an Extrusion Gun

Figure 007 / 51-76-11 (sheet 1) How to apply Sealant with an Extrusion Gun

Figure 008 / 51-76-11 (sheet 1) For Information Thickness of Sealant in Joint Assembly

Figure 009 / 51-76-11 (sheet 1) Clamping Sequence Principle

entry.title: AIRBUS章节号51-76-00
entry.content:
51-76-00 - Description - SEALING REPAIRS

51-76-00-描述-密封修理

1.General

A.The use of sealants in repair procedures and the repair of seals, is given in Chapter 51-76-11.

B.The repair of fuel tank sealing is given in Chapter 51-76-12.

C.It is recommended that Chapter 51-24-00, Sealing - General is read before using the information in Chapter 51-76-11 and Chapter 51-76-12.

2.Terms and Definitions

A.Table 1, below shows the terms, used in sealant procedures and their appropriate definitions.

TERMDEFINITION
Application Life<1>This is the period of time that is often referred to as ‘Pot Life’ and is the time that a sealant remains suitable for application after it has been mixed. Barrier coating a layer of quick-drying sealant is applied over a layer of slow-drying sealant before this sealant has fully cured. This is usually done to prevent swarf and other repair debris sticking to the original sealant, this allows the repair work to continue, if necessary, after a short time.
Protective CoatingA protective coating may be applied to protect the sealant in service.
Breakable JointA joint that can be easily disassembled.
CureThis refers to the change of a sealant from its original mixed condition to its final condition. This is usually caused by a chemical action when the two parts of a sealant are mixed together.
FilletReferred to as a bead and is formed when sealant is applied into gaps or corners in the structure. The bead can be formed from sealant that is applied for this purpose, or from the interfay sealant that is squeezed out when a joint is assembled.
Initial Cure Time <1>This is the minimum period of time required before a sealant is cured enough to permit a sealed joint to be pressure tested. Corresponding hardness is defined in each product Technical Data Sheet (TDS).
Interfay SealantA layer of sealant applied to the contacting (faying) surfaces of repair parts before they are assembled.
Leak PathThis is the path along which a fluid, for example, fuel or water, can get out of or into a sealed area.
OvercoatingThis term refers to the application of a brushing thickness sealant over a joint.
Tack Free Time <1>This is the period of time measured from when the sealant is mixed until its surface should be “touch dry”.
Work Life <1>This is the period of time within which a joint that must be sealed, must be riveted, bolted or temporarily fastened, after the sealant has been applied to the contacting surfaces of the joint.
Adhesion PromoterA material which may be used in conjunction with a sealant as an aid to adhesion on clean surface.

Table 1 - Terms and Definitions

<1>The actual times that are applicable to the terms are given in the manufacturer’s data sheets. Work life, application life, cure time and tack free time vary as a function of the temperature and of the relative humidity. Baseline temperature is 23° C and 50 +/- 5% hygrometry. Increasing the relative humidity reduces application, tack-free and curing time. Reducing relative humidity will increase these times. The same trend is observed with the temperature.

3.Sealing Repair Materials

A.Sealing material has to be selected depending on the use and area. The Consumable Material List (CML) gives the correspondence between the CML application code and the alternative products reference with necessary information from supplier.

Sealing products are supplied as two parts sets comprising of a base compound and an accelerator or premixed and frozen material (with limited shelf life).

An adhesion promoter may be required depending on the used sealant. The CML is providing the adhesion promoter reference if required (given in the comments) with the selected sealant.

The information in Table 1 is given for guidance only, the information given in the Manufacturer’s Data Sheets has precedence. Please refer to the CML for complete and up to date information concerning the products that are under a given application code.

MC-780 C 122014*24
MC-780 C 248020*24
MC-780 C 3612030*24
MC-780 C 4816856*24
MC-780 C 6025070*24
PR 1782 C 2424
PR 1782 C 12207*24
PR 1782 C 248021*24
PR 1782 C 3612028*24
PR 1782 C 4816856*24
PR 1782 C 7025070*24
06AFB1PR 1784 B 1/246with PR 186 or PR 141 depending polycarbonate or not
PR 1425 B 1/2824
PR 1425 B 12448
PR 1425 B 22448
04QAB2F69
06HAA1PR 1005LCoating to be applied on sealant

Table 2 - Consumable Material list

B.Repair Material Uses

(1)Sealant

Sealants are available with various viscosities and application times in hours noted as class.

The maximum application time in hours is indicated for each sealant by a dash number (e.g. ½ indicates a half hour application time). This application time is in standard temperature and hygrometry conditions.

The three following classes correspond to:

(a)Slightly fluid product applied by brush, syringe gun or bell. Usually used for fillet and fasteners overcoating.

(b)Thick product applied by spatula, extrusion gun, roller or syringe. Used for fillet bead and filling of cavities.

(c)Slightly fluid product, an aerobic polymerisation applied by brush, roller or spatula. Used for interfay and fastener wet installation.

(2)Adhesion Promoter

Adhesion promoter is applied by brushing or wiping. Excess of adhesion promoter must be removed with a clean lint free cloth.

Application of adhesion promoter in unprotected titanium may require specific care such as titanium part that must be at normal ambient temperature.

C.Mixing a Sealant and Sealant Preparation

You must only mix the two parts of matched base and curing agent together (check that batch numbers on both containers correspond). All equipment used in mixing and handling sealants must be clean and must not contaminate sealants such as wax coatings.

One of the following methods can be used.

(1)Manual Mixing

You must put the entire accelerator into the base compound and mix them together well. Do this until the color of the mixture is same. Try not to make air bubbles in the mixture. Do not deviate from mixing ratio given by manufacturer when using sealant supplied in bulk.

Short application life 1/6, 1/2 must only be mixed in small batches and close to the work area, check also the temperature and humidity.

(2)Cartridge Mixing

Pre-measured cartridges must be mixed manually or by cartridge mixers in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions for the time required to produce homogeneous mix.

(3)Storage of Sealant

(a)Storage of unmixed sealant

Sealant must be stored in unopened container between 10° C (50° F) to 27° C (80.6° F). Adhesion promoters are sensitive to moisture so container must be closed after each use.

(b)Storage of mixed and frozen tubes

It is forbidden to freeze thawed frozen sealant.

Refrigeration of mixed sealants must only be performed with sealants having an application life of 2 hours or more.

(c)Thawing of refrigerated sealants

Frozen sealants can be defrosted in heated water bath at 50° C (122° F) +/− 2° C (35.6° F) (thawing time around 4 minutes) or at ambient temperature (thawing time around 30 minutes). The core of the container must reach 16° C (60.8° F) (between 15° C (59° F) to 25° C (77° F)) before sealant application can start.

(d)Defrosting in microwave oven

Microwave equipment with power regulator, digital timer with +/− 0.5 minutes measuring accuracy, temperature control with +/− 2° C (35.6° F) accuracy, power level on the order of 650−700W.

A microwave oven can be used for sealant thawing (except syringes and 20 gram cups) providing it is not used for thawing other items such as food. The optimum defrost cycle must be established experimentally for each sealing compound, type of packing and quantity. The defrost cycle must be an interrupted cycle (i.e. 5s heat, 15s of soak), the number of cycles corresponding to the time required for the temperature at the core of sealant to reach a temperature between 15° C (59° F) to 25° C (77° F) (after 5 minutes homogenisation at room temperature, for cups you can mix the compound). The defrost cycle may vary from one oven to another. Microwaves can produce hot spots in the sealant therefore controls must be placed to ensure that the temperature of the defrosted sealant does not exceed 35° C (95° F) at any point of the container.

The containers must be placed on the edge of the turning plate never in its centre.

Only packages of the same type filled up with equal quantity, the same class of material and with the same life time can be defrosted in one same operation.

Defrosting of deep−frozen sealants reduce the application time by up to 45 minutes.

Sealant must never be defrosted in the microwave oven at full power. To ensure repeatability and temperature uniformity use low power setting i.e. 100W.

D.Sealant Application

(1)Environmental Condition

(a)You must not apply the sealant when the structure temperature is less than 10° C (50° F) or more than 50° C (122° F). The recommended conditions for mixing and application of sealants are:

Temperature 15° C (59° F) − 35° C (95° F), relative humidity 10−80% (Refer to Figure 001).

Figure 001 / 51-76-00 (sheet 1) Environmental Condition for Sealant Repair

(2)Sealant Curing

(a)Terminology

Application life is the time the mixed sealant remains at a consistency suitable for application. It is the time available for the sealant to wet the surface.

For fillet and overcoat sealants it is the maximum period of time within which sealant must be tooled into shape work life (assembly time, squeeze−out time, squeeze−out life).

For interfay sealants it is the period of time after mixing within which an interfay joint must be fastened at the required torque using permanent or temporary fasteners.

Tack free time is the time required for a curing sealant to loose surface tackiness or stickiness.

Cure time is the period of time after mixing that is required for the sealant to achieve a minimum hardness value of 35 shore A for polysulfide or 30 shore A for polythioether.

(b)Curing

Life of sealant is valid for a given temperature and humidity. It depends on sealant. Please refer to the manufacturer TDS for accurate information.

Sealant curing can be accelerated by heating after solvent flash off but not higher than 50° C (122° F). Refer to quick curing device for accelerating the sealant curing (Refer to Chapter 51-76-12). Above 50° C (122° F) bubbles will occur in sealant.

(c)Quick curing sealant device

Devices such as hot air blowers, infra-red lamps and thermoreactor technology, which uses catalytic combustion can be used.

1Description of the Thermoreactor

The thermoreactor is made of a catalytic support over which propane gas flows. The catalytic reaction then starts and extends over the catalytic element, refer to Figure 002. The thermoreactor produces infra−red radiation of between 2 and 10 microns.

Figure 002 / 51-76-00 (sheet 1) Principal of a Thermoreactor

2The advantage of this technique is in the energy transfer and the quality of the polymerization. Refer to Figure 003 which shows a comparison between the already existing hot air blower and the new electrical thermoreactor technology.

Figure 003 / 51-76-00 (sheet 1) Comparison between Hot Air Blower and Electrical Thermoreactor

3Refer to Figure 004 which shows an example of the typical time saved for sealant PR1422B2. In theoretical conditions (25° C (77° F) at 50% RH), the sealant has 35 shore A hardness after 30 hours, and the final hardness after 72 hours. With the thermoreactor, the sealant has the 35 shore A after 2.75 hours and is fully cured after 6 hours.

Figure 004 / 51-76-00 (sheet 1) Curing Diagram

4The basic equipment is composed of 2 portable boxes, refer to Figure 005.

One box is only for the gas supply and the other contains all the control equipment. The control equipment lets the operator:

-

select one of the sealants proposed (no other data is necessary),

-

add the specific data related to a different sealant.

Figure 005 / 51-76-00 (sheet 1) Rapid Curing Device

5Airline Curing Device (ACD 1001) is the device developed to accelerate the polymerisation of the sealant, refer to Figure 006.

A Windscreen Rapid Curing System (WRCS) has been specifically developed for windscreen sealant fast curing, refer to Figure 007.

For specific devices information refer to supplier address:

-

SUNAERO

70 Rue Ampere − BP58

Z.I Lyon Nord

69726 Genay Cedex

France

www.sunaero.com

Figure 006 / 51-76-00 (sheet 1) Airline Curing Device

Figure 007 / 51-76-00 (sheet 1) Windshield Rapid Curing Device

(d)Protective barrier coating

Product as per CML application code 06HAA1 applied on top of the sealant as protective overcoat or barrier coatings may be used as an aid to prevent damage or contamination of sealant which has not fully cured.

A barrier coating is applied on sealant after the sealant is tack free. Make sure that the barrier coat overlaps existing sealant around the repair area. If a second coat is applied, wait 20 minutes between layers.

This coating is not resistant to phosphate ester hydraulic fluid and will therefore only provide temporary protection. This method is not recommended for application in fuel tank to accelerate refuelling.

The preferred method is to use quick cure sealant or accelerate the cure cycle.
